tn.text: The writer, having shown that Christ's priesthood is better than the earthly priesthood, shows that the earthly priesthood was a pattern of heavenly things. Christ has a superior ministry, a superior covenant.
This does not mean "at this moment," but is used to draw attention to the important point that follows.
Even though the author uses the plural pronoun "we," he is most likely referring only to himself. AT: "I am saying" or "I am writing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])

tn.ref: sat down at the right hand
tn.text: Here "right hand" refers to a place of honor. AT: "he sat down in the place of honor." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:heb:01:01|1:3]].

tn.ref: of the throne of the Majesty
tn.text: Here "Majesty" refers to God, and "throne" refers to God's rule as kin. AT: "of God, who is our majestic king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the true tabernacle that the Lord, not a man, set up
tn.text: People built the earthly tabernacle out of animal skins fastened to a wooden framework, and they set it up in the manner of a tent. Here "true tabernacle" means the heavenly tabernacle that God created.

tn.ref: For every high priest is appointed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For God appoints every priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This does not mean "at this moment," but is used to draw attention to the important point that follows.
"as God requires in the law"
These words have similar meanings to emphasize that the tabernacle was merely an image of the real tabernacle in heaven. AT: "a vague image" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The author speaks of the earthly temple, which is a copy of the heavenly temple, as if it were a shadow. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: It is just as Moses was warned by God when he was
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It is just as God warned Moses when Moses was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: was about to construct the tabernacle
tn.text: Moses did not construct the tabernacle himself. He ordered the people to construct it. AT: "was about to command the people to construct the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Make sure"
"to the design"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that I showed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
You can make explicit that "mountain" refers to Mount Sinai. AT: "on Mount Sinai" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This section begins to show that the new covenant is better than the old covenant with Israel and Judah.
"God has given Christ"

tn.ref: a much better ministry. It is just as he is also the mediator of a better covenant
tn.text: "a much better ministry, just as Christ is the mediator of a better covenant"
This means Christ caused a better covenant between God and humans to exist.

tn.ref: which is based on better promises
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It was this covenant that God made based on better promises" or "God promised better things when he made this covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The words "first" and "second" are ordinal numbers. AT: "old covenant ... new covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"had been perfect"
In this quotation the prophet Jeremiah foretold of a new covenant that God would make.
"with the people of Israel"
"Look" or "Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you"
The future is spoken of as if it were moving toward the speaker. AT: "there will be a time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the house of Israel and with the house of Judah
tn.text: The people of Israel and Judah are spoken of as if they were houses. AT: "the people of Israel and with the people of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I took them by their hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt
tn.text: This metaphor represents God's great love and concern. AT: "I led them out of Egypt like a father leads his young child" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: they did not continue in my covenant
tn.text: To obey God's covenant is spoken of as if one were to continue in it. AT: "they did not obey my covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is a quotation from the prophet Jeremiah.
The people of Israel are spoken of as if they were a house. AT: "the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"after that time"

tn.ref: I will put my laws into their minds
tn.text: God's requirements are spoken of as if they were objects that could be placed somewhere. People's ability to think is spoken of as if it were a place. AT: "I will enable them to understand my laws" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will also write them on their hearts
tn.text: People's hearts, imagined to be the center of their loyalty to God, are spoken of as if they were a page that could be written on. AT: "I will also enable them to obey my laws sincerely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"I will be the God they worship"
"they will be the people for whom I care"
This continues the  quotation from the prophet Jeremiah.

tn.ref: They will not teach each one his neighbor and each one his brother, saying, 'Know the Lord.'
tn.text: This direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "They will not need to teach their neighbors or brothers to know me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
Both of these refer to fellow Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: Know the Lord ... all will know me
tn.text: "Know" here stands for acknowledge. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This stands for the people who committed these unrighteous acts. AT: "to those who did unrighteous acts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I will not remember their sins any longer
tn.text: Here "remember" stands for "think about." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"has almost disappeared" or "will soon disappear"
